zone.line: thought
I have concieved it most favourable to the
cause of truth to set down these remarks
according to the order in which they
were suggested to my mind by a consideration
-deration of the subject itself, instead
of following that of the treatise which
excited me to make them public.
Thus although devoid of the formality
if they should views which they contain be just
of a polemical reply, they will be
found to involve a refutation of
the doctrines of the "Four Ages of Poetry",
if so far at least as regards the
first division of the subject.—- I can
readily conjecture what should have moved
the gall of the learned & intelligent
Author of that paper; I confess myself
like him unwilling to be stunned by
the Theseids of the hoarse Codri of the
day: Bavius & Maevius undoubtedly are,
as they ever were, insufferable persons.
